title: Question 6
prompt:
Sentence 11: If you have enjoyed aspects of your work; let the firm know that you’ll miss these elements of your job.

Which correction should be made to sentence 11?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
The phrase “if you have enjoyed aspects of your work” is a subordinate clause. It cannot stand alone as an independent clause because of the word if. “If you have enjoyed aspects of your work” is not a complete thought. A subordinate clause cannot be joined to an independent clause by a semicolon. A comma separates a subordinate clause at the beginning of a sentence from the main clause.
If you have enjoyed aspects of your work, let the firm know that you’ll miss these elements of your job.
